Advanced Configuration Guide

Last updated: March 20, 2024 15 min read
Configuration Overview

This guide covers advanced configuration options for power users and developers who need fine-grained control over the application behavior.

Environment Settings

Configure the application for different deployment environments.

Development Environment

Settings optimized for local development and debugging.

Debug Options
  • Verbose Logging

    Enable detailed console output for troubleshooting

    Example Configuration
    
{
  "debug": {
    "verbose": true,
    "logLevel": "debug"
  }
}
  • Hot Reload

    Automatically refresh on code changes

Production Environment

Optimized settings for live deployment.

Performance Options
  • Minification

    Compress assets for faster loading

  • Caching Strategy

    Configure browser and server-side caching

Database Configuration

Set up database connections and optimization.

Supported Databases

PostgreSQL

Configuration for PostgreSQL databases.

Connection Pool Settings

  • Max Connections

    Maximum number of concurrent connections

  • Idle Timeout

    Time before idle connections are closed

  • Connection Retry

    Automatic retry logic for failed connections

MongoDB

NoSQL database configuration options.

Replica Set Configuration

  • Primary Node

    Main database server configuration

  • Secondary Nodes

    Backup and read replica settings

Authentication Configuration

Configure various authentication methods and security settings.

Supported Authentication Methods

OAuth 2.0 Setup

Configure OAuth providers for social login.

Google OAuth

Integration with Google OAuth services.

Required Configuration

  • Client ID

    Obtained from Google Developer Console

  • Client Secret

    Secure credential for server-side requests

GitHub OAuth

Developer-focused authentication via GitHub.

  • App Registration

    Register your application in GitHub Developer Settings

JWT Token Configuration

Settings for JSON Web Token authentication.

Token Parameters
  • Expiration Time

    How long tokens remain valid

  • Signing Algorithm

    Cryptographic method for token signing

  • Refresh Strategy

    Automatic token renewal configuration

Performance Optimization

Advanced performance tuning and optimization strategies.

Caching Configuration

Multi-layer caching strategy implementation.

Memory Cache

In-memory caching for frequently accessed data.

Configuration Options

  • Max Memory Usage

    Limit cache size to prevent memory issues

  • TTL (Time To Live)

    Automatic expiration of cached items

  • LRU Eviction

    Remove least recently used items when full

Redis Cache

Distributed caching with Redis.

Redis Configuration

  • Connection String

    Redis server connection details

  • Cluster Mode

    Enable Redis clustering for high availability

Database Optimization

Query optimization and database performance tuning.

Query Optimization

  • Index Strategy

    Proper indexing for faster queries

  • Query Analysis

    Identify and optimize slow queries

Monitoring and Logging

Set up comprehensive monitoring and logging systems.

Application Monitoring
Metrics Collection

Gather performance and usage metrics.

  • Response Time Metrics

    Track API and page load times

  • Error Rate Monitoring

    Monitor application error frequency

  • Resource Usage

    CPU, memory, and disk utilization

Log Aggregation

Centralized logging for easier debugging.

  • Log Level Configuration

    Control verbosity of application logs

Deployment Configuration

Settings for different deployment scenarios and environments.

Container Deployment

Docker and Kubernetes configuration options.

Docker Configuration

Optimize container settings for production deployment.

Kubernetes Setup

Orchestration and scaling configuration.
